name: repopulate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] to go and live in a place that people have moved away from, or to cause people to do this: The islands have been repopulated by their original inhabitants, who were removed from their homes 30 years ago. People are moving to the countryside at such a pace that the government now faces the challenge of repopulating cities.
[ I or T ] (of plants and animals) to produce enough young plants or animals to replace plants or animals that have died: It takes mosquitos about two weeks to breed and repopulate. The big question is whether enough fish have survived to repopulate the river.
More examplesFewer examplesThe residential units will repopulate a part of the city which at present is home to only a handful of residents.The company had promised to repopulate the city's West Side with highly paid consultants.I never expected otters to repopulate as well as they have.
